glsa.title: OptiPNG: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in OptiPNG might result in user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: OptiPNG is a PNG optimizer that recompresses image files to a smaller size, without losing any information.

description.p: A buffer overflow in the BMP reader in OptiPNG has been reported.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted BMP image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OptiPNG users should upgrade to the latest version:
